Swift: Gestures

Sunday, March 22, 2015

Overview

Gestures are a big part of mobile development. This post is all about how to add gestures in iOS dev. You can find more information about gestures on Ray Wenderlichâ€™s site or on ioscreator.

Content

Pan Gesture

 1 @IBOutlet weak var pannableView: UIView {
 2     didSet {
 3         // the ':' means that the method pan will be called with an argument
 4         let recognizer = UIPanGestureRecognizer(target: self, action: "pan:")
 5         pannableView.addGestureRecognizer(recognizer)
 6     }
 7 }
 8 func pan(gesture: UIPanGestureRecognizer) {
 9     switch gesture.state {
10         case .Changed: fallthrough
11         case .Ended:
12             let translation = gesture.translationInView(pannableView)
13             // update anything that depends on the pan gesture using tranlation.x and .y
14             gesture.setTranslation(CGPointZero, inView:pannableView)
15     }
16 }

Pinch

 1 @IBOutlet weak var pinchableView: UIView {
 2     didSet {
 3         let recognizer = UIPinchGestureRecognizer(target: self, action: "pinch:")
 4         pinchableView.addGestureRecognizer(recognizer)
 5     }
 6 }
 7 func pinch(gesture: UIPinchGestureRecognizer) {
 8     switch gesture.state {
 9         case .Began:
10         case .Changed:
11         case .Ended:
12         case .Recognized
13     }
14     var scale:CGFloat = gesture.scale        // can reset
15     var velocity:CGFloat = gesture.velocity  // readonly how fast you pinch
16 }

Rotate

 1 @IBOutlet weak var rotatableView: UIView {
 2     didSet {
 3         let recognizer = UIRotationGestureRecognizer(target: self, action: "rotate:")
 4         rotatableView.addGestureRecognizer(recognizer)
 5     }
 6 }
 7 func rotate(gesture: UIRotationGestureRecognizer) {
 8     var rotation:CGFloat = gesture.rotation  // can reset
 9     var velocity:CGFloat = gesture.velocity  // readonly how fast you rotate
10 }

Swipe

 1 @IBOutlet weak var swipableView: UIView {
 2     didSet {
 3         let recognizer = UISwipeGestureRecognizer(target: self, action: "swipe:")
 4         rotatableView.addGestureRecognizer(recognizer)
 5     }
 6 }
 7 func swipe(gesture: UISwipeGestureRecognizer) {
 8     var direction:UISwipeGestureRecognizerDirection = gesture.direction
 9     var numberOfTouchesRequired:Int = gesture.numberOfTouchesRequired
10 }

Tap

 1 @IBOutlet weak var tapableView: UIView {
 2     didSet {
 3         let recognizer = UITapGestureRecognizer(target: self, action: "tap:")
 4         rotatableView.addGestureRecognizer(recognizer)
 5     }
 6 }
 7 func tap(gesture: UITapGestureRecognizer) {
 8     var numberOfTapsRequired:Int = gesture.numberOfTapsRequired // single tap, double tap, etc
 9     var numberOfTouchesRequired:Int = gesture.numberOfTouchesRequired
10 }
